intro: Phyllanthus betsileanus subsp. isalensis, commonly known as the Isalensis Phyllanthus, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has smooth, often reddish stems and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
